Package se.arkalix.security

Class X509Certificates

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.arkalix.security.X509Certificates
  • public class X509Certificates
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper functions for extracting information from x.509 certificates that is particularly relevant to the Arrowhead Framework.

    • Method Detail

      • subjectArrowheadNameOf

        public static java.util.Optional<X509ArrowheadName> subjectArrowheadNameOf​(java.security.cert.X509Certificate certificate)
        Searches for and extracts the leftmost Common Name (CN) from the subject Distinguished Name (DN) of the given x.509 certificate, which is then converted into an Arrowhead X509ArrowheadName.

        The current evaluation version of Arrowhead Framework demands that only one CN is stated in the subject field of an x.509 certificate, and that it contains what we here refer to as an Arrowhead certificate descriptor, which is a four-part domain name consisting of (1) a system or operator identifier, (2) a cloud identifier, (3) a company identifier and (4) a master certificate identifier, which must be "arrowhead.eu". While it is currently common for Internet servers to use the subject CN attribute to tie their x.509 certificates to particular domain names, the practice was deprecated already in RFC 2818, which requires that the SubjectAlternativeName extension be used for that purpose instead. This frees up the CN for other uses, which is taken advantage of by the Arrowhead Framework.

        Parameters:
        certificate - Certificate from which to extract Arrowhead certificate descriptor.
        Returns:
        Arrowhead certificate descriptor, if a valid CN is present in subject DN string of the given certificate.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If certificate contains a subject CN, but it is not a valid Arrowhead certificate descriptor.
        X509NameException - If certificate contains a DN string that is not standards-compliant.
        See Also:
        RFC 2818, Section 3.1, RFC 4515, Section 3, RFC 4512, Section 1.4

      • subjectCommonNameOf

        public static java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> subjectCommonNameOf​(java.security.cert.X509Certificate certificate)
        Searches for and extracts the leftmost Common Name (CN) from the subject Distinguished Name (DN) from given x.509 certificate.
        Parameters:
        certificate - Certificate from which to extract CN.
        Returns:
        Extracted CN, if a valid such is present in the subject DN string of the given certificate.
        Throws:
        X509NameException - If provided DN string is not standards- compliant.
        See Also:
        RFC 4514, RFC 5280
